abstract: The federal appeals court’s decision came after a finding that the Interior Department had failed to conduct an environmental study before issuing the company’s drilling permit.
snippet: The federal appeals court’s decision came after a finding that the Interior Department had failed to conduct an environmental study before issuing the company’s drilling permit.
lead_paragraph: A federal appeals court on Thursday blocked Royal Dutch Shell from drilling oil wells off Alaska’s North Slope after finding that the Interior Department had failed to conduct an environmental study before issuing the company’s drilling permit.

headline.main: Court Says Shell Can’t Drill Near Alaska
headline.print_headline: Court Says Shell Can’t Drill Near Alaska
